page.title: 01South Clevedon & Kenn
page.content: {Landscape of the area.}This area lies to the south of the Victorian town of {Clevedon }and includes the village of{Kenn. }The land within the boundaries of{Clevedon}has been newly developed since the coming of the{M5.} There are many new estates lying on each side of a ring road.There are two blocks of industrial units and a large engineering factory. There are three rivers flowing through the area,the Land Yeo,the Middle Yeo and the Blind Yeo and it is from these that the area gets its name"{Yeo-Moor} ".Between the town and the village of Kenn lies flat farming land.This land was once under water and is still very marshy and divided by man-made drains called{Rhynes.}These are a natural habitat of much wild life,particularly herons.
